name: Flame Gatling
effect: At the start of your next turn after you activate this system, gain 2 Heat and draw a Line 5 area from your mech. Targets caught in this area take 2 Energy damage and 4 Burn, or half damage on an Engineering save. You are Slowed and cannot fire weapons while this system is active.
description: A chemical-based incendiary system with a system of rotating barrels to extend operational lifespan allows a terrifying deluge of flame after a predictable windup. Limited fuel canisters and heat venting requirements interfere with normal weapons usage when the barrels are spinning up.

name: ANANSI-Class NHP

effect.detail: Your mech gains the AI property and the ANANSI protocol.

abilities.detail: Your attacks gain +1 knockback. You gain the Graceful Dance Reaction. This effect ends at the start of your next turn.

abilities.trigger: You cause knockback to an enemy.
abilities.detail: You may push yourself an equal number of spaces in a direction of your choosing, as long as that direction is not directly towards your target. This counts as involuntary movement and ignores reactions.

description: ANANSI-class NHPs were born from an experiment in analyzing biometrics data from skydiving flight suits. The statistical paradoxes in simulating the goal of regulation of vital signs across a wide variety of phenotypes, genotypes, and environmental conditions resulted in an NHP with a personality humble and prideful simultaneously, constantly calculating odds and how to beat them by ignoring factory specs. ANANSI-class NHPs consistently cascade ahead of schedule; proactive cycling is advised along with aggressive maintenance of the hardware it is installed on.

effect.name: Saturation Drone
effect.detail: Cannon and Launcher attacks within a Burst 2 radius of this drone have +1 Accuracy.
You may deploy two charges per Limited use (two grenades / a grenade and a mine / two mines per Limited use).

charges.name: C80 Grenade
charges.detail: Targets caught in the area of effect may make an Agility save to take half damage.

name: Lion Coast Missiles
effect: Limited uses start at 0 - you gain 1 charge upon Stabilizing or get a kill with the System. Requires Lock on to fire. If the tech attack succeeds, you fire a Hound Missile (Size 1, HP ,  which deals 3d6 explosive damage in a Blast 1 from the target - they may perform an Agility save to take half damage.

name: Nano Solder
effect: Deploys a Blast 1 area. Allies can walk into/over this and spend a Quick action to gain 1d6 Overshield. This area has 3 charges before it fades.

name: Double Time Armor
effect: You gain 1 Speed until the end of your next turn after getting hit.

effect.detail: Has a Cone 5 flamethrower attached, when fired targets caught in the area must make an ENGINEERING save. On a successful save, the target takes 1 Energy Damage; on a failed save the target takes 1 Burn.

name: Universal Recycler
effect:
As a Quick Action you may convert a Drone or Mech wreck that is adjacent to you into an allied drone.
You may move the drone 4 spaces in any direction at the start of your turn as a protocol.
This Drone makes an attack roll at the nearest target to it that it has LoS to, using your Grit modifier to deal 3 damage. This effect triggers 1/round at the same time you perform the Skirmish action.

name: Liquid Armor
effect: 1/round when you are Slowed, roll a d6; on a 4+ you ignore it.

charges.name: Scatter Mine
charges.detail: When you deploy a Scatter Mine, you deploy two. They have a cone 5 firing area, and anyone caught within them may make a HULL save to take half damage.

charges.name: Volatile Mine
charges.detail: Deals 1d6 bonus damage to flying/hovering targets caught in the blast area.

name: Starfish Charges

charges.name: Pinwheel Grenade
charges.detail: When thrown, the detonation creates 3 Line 3 areas originating from the targeted space. Characters caught in these areas take 2 damage, or half damage on a successful Hull Save.

charges.name: Supernova Mine
charges.detail: When detonated, this system creates 3 Line 5 areas originating from the mine’s space. These areas can overlap and target the same character up to one additional time.  Characters caught in these areas for 2 damage, or half damage on a successful Hull Save.

description:
A pinwheel-shaped charge, designed to saturate the target area with plasma. Crude, unfocused - not enough to get through ship armor, but more than enough to decrew it.

“The Barons like to throw a bunch of these down a shaft and think it’ll get the job done. Not enough force to take down a p-g on their own, more than enough when you throw a dozen.”

name: Distributed Tactical Net

options.name: TacNet Mark
options.detail: Make a tech attack against another character in sensor range. On hit, the character takes 2 heat and the next attack to hit that character deals an additional 4 heat and 2 knockback to that character.

options.name: Positional Mapping
options.detail: Place 3 size ½ tokens within sensor range on free spaces or on spaces with planted mines. The next grenade thrown onto those spaces or mine detonated on those spaces deals an additional 2 heat and 1 knockback to up to 3 targets caught in the area of effect (up to 6 heat total).

description:
Baronic command-and-control units rely on telemetrics provided by frontline scouts to coordinate fire support missions and troop movements.

“Hacking the BUC just isn’t fun any more. It’s all information we already know - where we are, where we’re going, what’s going to blow us up.”

name: Binary Charges

charges.name: Blaze Grenade
charges.detail: This area created by this grenade lasts until the end of your turn. At the end of your turn, this explosion causes a new secondary Blast 1 area in a free space within Range 3 of the original. 1/round, Characters caught in either area or moving into it for the first time on their turn take 2 Burn on a failed AGILITY save. The secondary area expires at the start of your next turn.

charges.name: Glory Mine
charges.detail: When detonated, this system detonates in a series of sinusoidal lasers, creating 3 Burst 1 areas within range 2 of the mine’s space. These areas cannot overlap. Characters within the affected areas must succeed on an AGILITY save or take 3 Burn. On a success, they take 2 Burn.

description: “I saw one of the Barons, looking at me from the top of the ruins, caught his grenade on rebar, just laughing to himself. Didn’t miss a beat as he keyed the release and watched the charge sail down past us and into our fellow cell on the first floor. Never stopped laughing.”

name: Picosilicon Spray
effect:
This reservoir of chemicals contains two active agents used to manipulate terrain and objects and can be activated in either mode with a Full Action.
Sledgehammer Mode: An adjacent Object, Drone, or Deployable gains (8) OVERSHIELD. If this overshield is depleted, the object explodes in a Burst 2 area and affected targets must make a Hull save or be knocked back 2 spaces and become Prone on a failed save.

“Sixty” Solvent Mode: Deal 20AP damage to an adjacent Object, Drone, or Deployable. If this would bring the object’s HP to 1 or less, the object’s HP becomes 1. Other characters involuntarily moved into the affected spaces of the object, Drone, or Deployable afterwards must pass a Hull save or become Immobilized in the closest available space of the object that fits the character.
description:
“We keep finding this stuff abandoned among Baronic armories. Nobody wants it - it’s supposed to solidify clay for building fortifications, and it makes it either too brittle or too soft. Doesn’t explain why our Kobolds keep blowing themselves up when using Seismic Pulses.”
“Think it’s haunted?”
“It’s chemistry, how can it be haunted? There’s nothing alive in there.”

name: BANSHEE-Class NHP

effect.detail: Your mech gains the AI property and the Uncaring Scream reaction. This AI always cascades on a Direct Hit Structure check result and automatically ends cascade when the closest character at the time of structure check is Destroyed. When cascading, it always prioritizes causing Prone, then Destroyed status to the nearest character by any means and Uncaring Howl’s heat cost is reduced to 1.

abilities.trigger: You take damage from an actor.
abilities.detail: You gain resistance to that actor’s damage until the end of your next turn. If you are attacked by a closer hostile actor, as a reaction you can gain resistance to that character’s attack's damage until the end of your next turn for no heat cost. These effects continue until you do not take any damage until the beginning of your next turn.

description: Captured HORUS agitators embedded among the yielded several PLAYER_TWO COMP/CON units, subsequently reverse engineered by the BDF and installed in scout-pattern Kampilan frames as a long range search and destroy unit operating independently of resupply for extended periods. These PLAYER_TWO units, designed to operate a soldier’s hardsuit while they slept based on data from a flash pattern of their subjectivity, were scrubbed of any code related to HORUS and severed from the subjectivity of the soldier - a machine to fight when the soldier could not.

name: Coolant Flush

effect.detail: Until the end of your next turn, all incoming Tech Attacks have +2 DIFFICULTY to hit you and your Tech Attacks gain +2 Difficulty.

description: Can’t be hacked if they can’t get a signal.

name: Shock Armor
effect: You may activate this system as a Protocol. Until the end of your next turn, when hit by a melee attack while Grappling, the damage is reduced by 2 at a cost of 1 HEAT per attack.
description: Armor heats up, flakes off; pilot stays cool.

name: CALCIUM-class NHP
effect: Your mech gains the AI tag. +2 knockback on melee attacks. When enemies knocked back by your attacks come into contact with objects, that object takes 5 AP KINETIC damage. If the object is destroyed, a Cone 3 shockwave originates from the target. Targets affected by the area, including the target, take 1d6+1 damage on a failed HULL save.

name: Carapace Crash Pads
effect: Gain resistance to falling damage and +1 accuracy on checks and saves versus Immobilized.

name: QUEEN-Class Refraction Laser
effect: Gain a charge when you cool to zero heat, up to two. Expend a charge as a Quick on a character in range 8 for 1d6 Energy damage half on save; repeat this save on two targets within range 3 for 2 Energy damage each
description: The QUEEN-class refraction laser fills the most fundamental tactical need identified in ship to ship combat involving fights in long hallways - how to shoot without being exposed.

effect.detail: Your mech gains the AI tag and the DAEVA Protocol.

abilities.detail: Expend a charge to allow your next ranged or melee attack to be drawn from a number of spaces away from you equal to the heat generated by this protocol, as long as the weapon deals any Explosive or Burn.
